title: Response Time: Vol. 40
description: In our latest ‚ÄúResponse Time‚Äù interview, we ask Kostas Sveronis, Technical Support Manager at Yodeck, about the essence of great customer service, and more.
author: Kate Sugrue
excerpt: We ask Kostas Sveronis, Technical Support Manager at Yodeck, about the essence of great customer service, and more.
text: Senior Manager, Advocacy & Community Marketing, Intercom @KateSugrue You satisfy your customers, but can you satisfy our curiosity? With Kostas Sveronis, Technical Support Manager at Yodeck. Please tell us a little bit about your company and what you do there. Yodeck is a digital signage company that helps you display any content you want on a TV screen. You can manage the content and the screens remotely with a few simple clicks. As the Technical Support Manager, I ensure that all of our clients ‚Äì paid or free ‚Äì are treated in the best way possible. Which celebrity would be really great at your job, and why? Tom Hanks because he inspires calmness and trust. This is what a customer needs when they are in a challenging position. What‚Äôs the most valuable thing that working in customer service has taught you? Empathy and patience! Those two values are the alpha and omega when you work in this industry. Describe the essence of great customer service using only three words. Empathy, patience, and awareness. Which movie robot would you choose as your AI sidekick? Sonny from i, Robot. Do you identify more with the title ‚Äúcustomer support,‚Äù ‚Äúcustomer service,‚Äù ‚Äúcustomer success,‚Äù or ‚Äúcustomer experience,‚Äù and why? I identify most with ‚Äúcustomer experience‚Äù because it focuses on the customer‚Äôs entire journey with our company. It‚Äôs about creating positive, seamless experiences that build trust and satisfaction at every step. What‚Äôs the one piece of advice you would give to your peers in the customer service industry? Listen to your customers, and do what‚Äôs possible to support and solve their problems in a timely manner. What‚Äôs the worst customer service you‚Äôve ever experienced? One of the worst things is being unable to reach a company‚Äôs support. I had an issue with one of my devices, and the warranty ended in 15 days. I tried to reach their support for 15 days and was still waiting for a response. After one month, they came back to me saying that the warranty had expired and that they could not do much about it. After a lot of back-and-forth emails, they made an exception and replaced my device. If customer service was an Olympic sport, what would be the main event? A marathon for sure! The customers never end, and you need to keep performing day after day. What‚Äôs the best thing a customer has ever said to you? ‚ÄúYour dedication and professionalism make a significant difference in our daily operations, and it‚Äôs truly appreciated. Thank you for your outstanding support and for always going above and beyond to ensure everything runs smoothly.‚Äù What gif best describes your mental state right now? Where do you get your support leadership news? Support Driven and LinkedIn. What‚Äôs the strangest thing a customer has asked you? Someone asked if we could schedule a second call to talk more about our personal lives. ü§∑ As a support team, we are also responsible for providing wellness support for our customers. What‚Äôs your most used emoji in customer chats? üòÖ Conversation closed‚Ä¶ for now üòè If you‚Äôre interested in being featured in our¬†Response Time series, you can share your insights on customer service ‚Äì and what your greatest productivity hack is ‚Äì with us here. html:
Senior Manager, Advocacy & Community Marketing, Intercom

@KateSugrue

You satisfy your customers, but can you satisfy our curiosity?

With Kostas Sveronis, Technical Support Manager at Yodeck.

Please tell us a little bit about your company and what you do there.
Yodeck is a digital signage company that helps you display any content you want on a TV screen. You can manage the content and the screens remotely with a few simple clicks. As the Technical Support Manager, I ensure that all of our clients ‚Äì paid or free ‚Äì are treated in the best way possible.

Which celebrity would be really great at your job, and why?
Tom Hanks because he inspires calmness and trust. This is what a customer needs when they are in a challenging position.

What‚Äôs the most valuable thing that working in customer service has taught you?
Empathy and patience! Those two values are the alpha and omega when you work in this industry.

Describe the essence of great customer service using only three words.
Empathy, patience, and awareness.

Which movie robot would you choose as your AI sidekick?
Sonny from i, Robot.

Do you identify more with the title ‚Äúcustomer support,‚Äù ‚Äúcustomer service,‚Äù ‚Äúcustomer success,‚Äù or ‚Äúcustomer experience,‚Äù and why?
I identify most with ‚Äúcustomer experience‚Äù because it focuses on the customer‚Äôs entire journey with our company. It‚Äôs about creating positive, seamless experiences that build trust and satisfaction at every step.

What‚Äôs the one piece of advice you would give to your peers in the customer service industry?
Listen to your customers, and do what‚Äôs possible to support and solve their problems in a timely manner.

What‚Äôs the worst customer service you‚Äôve ever experienced?
One of the worst things is being unable to reach a company‚Äôs support. I had an issue with one of my devices, and the warranty ended in 15 days. I tried to reach their support for 15 days and was still waiting for a response. After one month, they came back to me saying that the warranty had expired and that they could not do much about it. After a lot of back-and-forth emails, they made an exception and replaced my device.

If customer service was an Olympic sport, what would be the main event?
A marathon for sure! The customers never end, and you need to keep performing day after day.

What‚Äôs the best thing a customer has ever said to you?
‚ÄúYour dedication and professionalism make a significant difference in our daily operations, and it‚Äôs truly appreciated. Thank you for your outstanding support and for always going above and beyond to ensure everything runs smoothly.‚Äù

What gif best describes your mental state right now?

Where do you get your support leadership news?
Support Driven and LinkedIn.

What‚Äôs the strangest thing a customer has asked you?
Someone asked if we could schedule a second call to talk more about our personal lives. ü§∑ As a support team, we are also responsible for providing wellness support for our customers.

What‚Äôs your most used emoji in customer chats?
üòÖ

Conversation closed‚Ä¶ for now üòè

If you‚Äôre interested in being featured in our¬†Response Time series, you can share your insights on customer service ‚Äì and what your greatest productivity hack is ‚Äì with us here.
